awd_titl_txt: Growth of Error in a Tropical Atlantic Model
awd_abstract_narration: The goal of the Seasonal Equatorial Atlantic                            Experiment (SEQUAL) was to explain the response of the                          Equatorial Atlantic ocean to the forcing winds.  A set                          of models was developed and a very complete set of data                         (winds, currents, temperature) was obtained in                                  1983-1984.                                                                              The purpose of this proposal is to study the                            propagation and growth of errors in a dynamical model of                        the Equatorial Atlantic from initial conditions set by                          observations and subsequent data assimilation olf new                           observations in space and time.  This is an important                           task for the TOGA program and fundatmental issue for                            model validation in general.
